title: 1 Kings Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of 1 Kings with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 22 chapters.

questions.question: Who was the young woman brought to King David to care for him in his old age?
questions.explanation: Abishag the Shunammite was sought for and brought to King David to stand before him and minister to him in his old age (1 Kings 1:3-4).

questions.question: Which son of David exalted himself and prepared chariots and horsemen to claim the throne?
questions.explanation: Adonijah, son of Haggith, exalted himself and prepared chariots and horsemen to claim kingship (1 Kings 1:5-6).

questions.question: Who advised Bathsheba to remind King David of his oath that Solomon should reign after him?
questions.explanation: Nathan the prophet counseled Bathsheba to remind King David of his oath regarding Solomon's succession (1 Kings 1:11-13).

questions.question: Where was Solomon anointed king according to David's command?
questions.explanation: David commanded Solomon to be anointed at Gihon by Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet (1 Kings 1:33-35).

questions.question: How did the people react when Solomon was anointed king?
questions.explanation: After Solomon was anointed, the people blew trumpets and shouted, 'God save king Solomon' (1 Kings 1:39-40).

questions.question: What was King Solomon's famous request to God when he became king?
questions.explanation: Solomon asked God for an understanding heart to judge the people wisely (1 Kings 3:9).

questions.question: In Solomon's judgment between the two women claiming a baby, what did he propose to determine the true mother?
options: To give the baby to the first woman
To cut the child in two
To ask the elders to decide
questions.correctAnswer: To cut the child in two
questions.explanation: Solomon proposed to cut the living child in two to reveal the true mother by her compassion (1 Kings 3:25).

questions.question: How many years did Solomon take to build the temple of the LORD?
questions.explanation: Solomon took seven years to complete building the Temple (1 Kings 6:38).

questions.question: What was the length of the temple Solomon built for the LORD?
questions.explanation: The temple Solomon built was sixty cubits in length (1 Kings 6:2).

questions.question: What material covered the entire inside of the temple Solomon built?
questions.explanation: The temple's inside was overlaid with pure gold, including the walls and the floor (1 Kings 6:21-22, 30).

questions.question: Who came to Solomon with a riddle about the lion and the lamb?
questions.explanation: The Queen of Sheba visited Solomon and tested his wisdom with hard questions and riddles (1 Kings 10:1).

questions.question: How did Solomon demonstrate his wisdom before the Queen of Sheba?
questions.explanation: Solomon answered all her questions and showed her the wealth and wisdom of his kingdom (1 Kings 10:3-4).

questions.question: What was one consequence of Solomon's marriages to many strange women?
options: He built many temples to idols
questions.correctAnswer: He built many temples to idols
questions.explanation: Solomon's wives turned his heart after other gods, and he built high places for idol worship (1 Kings 11:4-7).

questions.question: Who was the prophet that rebuked Solomon for his idolatry and foretold the kingdom's division?
questions.explanation: Ahijah the prophet foretold the division of the kingdom because of Solomon's sin (1 Kings 11:29-31).

questions.question: What was the name of the northern kingdom's first king after the division?
questions.explanation: Jeroboam became king over the ten tribes of Israel after the kingdom divided (1 Kings 12:20).

questions.question: What advice did the old men give Rehoboam when he asked about how to rule the people?
questions.explanation: The old men advised Rehoboam to serve the people kindly and be a servant to them (1 Kings 12:7).

questions.question: What advice did Rehoboam follow instead, leading to the kingdom's division?
options: Be harsh and increase the yoke
questions.correctAnswer: Be harsh and increase the yoke
questions.explanation: Rehoboam rejected the old men's advice and followed the young men, increasing the yoke on the people (1 Kings 12:14).

questions.question: What two golden calves did Jeroboam make for the people to worship?
questions.explanation: Jeroboam made two golden calves to prevent people from going to Jerusalem, setting them up at Bethel and Dan (1 Kings 12:28-29).

questions.question: How did the prophet from Judah react when Jeroboam's altar at Bethel was about to be used for sacrifice?
options: He cursed the altar and predicted its destruction
questions.correctAnswer: He cursed the altar and predicted its destruction
questions.explanation: The prophet pronounced judgment on the altar, declaring it would be broken and ashes poured on it (1 Kings 13:2).

questions.question: What happened to the prophet who disobeyed God's command and ate bread in Bethel?
options: He was killed by a lion
questions.correctAnswer: He was killed by a lion
questions.explanation: Because he disobeyed God's command, the prophet was killed by a lion on his way home (1 Kings 13:24).

questions.question: How long did King Ahab reign over Israel?
questions.explanation: Ahab reigned over Israel for twenty-two years (1 Kings 16:29).

questions.question: Who was the prophet that challenged the prophets of Baal on Mount Carmel?
questions.explanation: Elijah challenged the prophets of Baal on Mount Carmel to prove the LORD's power (1 Kings 18:20-40).

questions.question: What miracle did Elijah perform to show God's power on Mount Carmel?
questions.explanation: Elijah prayed, and fire from the LORD consumed the altar, wood, stones, and water (1 Kings 18:38).

questions.question: What did Jezebel do after Elijah's victory over the prophets of Baal?
options: She built a temple for God
questions.explanation: Jezebel threatened Elijah's life and sought to kill him (1 Kings 19:1-2).

questions.question: Where did Elijah encounter God after fleeing Jezebel's threat?
questions.explanation: Elijah met God at Mount Horeb in a cave (1 Kings 19:8-13).

questions.question: How did God manifest Himself to Elijah at Mount Horeb?
questions.explanation: God was not in the wind, earthquake, or fire, but in a still small voice (1 Kings 19:11-12).

questions.question: Who succeeded Elijah as prophet?
questions.explanation: Elisha was called by Elijah to be his successor (1 Kings 19:19-21).

questions.question: What did Elisha do when Elijah was taken to heaven?
questions.explanation: Elisha caught Elijah's mantle as he was taken up in a chariot of fire (1 Kings 2:13-14 references 2 Kings 2 for ascension).

questions.question: What was the cause of King Ahab's death in battle?
questions.explanation: King Ahab was wounded by an arrow in battle and died later from his wounds (1 Kings 22:34-37).

questions.question: True or False: Solomon built the temple of the LORD in just three years.
questions.explanation: Solomon took seven years to build the temple, not three (1 Kings 6:38).

questions.question: True or False: Solomon had 700 wives and 300 concubines.
questions.explanation: Solomon had seven hundred wives and three hundred concubines (1 Kings 11:3).

questions.question: True or False: The Queen of Sheba visited Solomon to test his wisdom with riddles and hard questions.
questions.explanation: The Queen of Sheba came to test Solomon's wisdom with difficult questions (1 Kings 10:1-3).

questions.question: True or False: Jeroboam set up golden calves in Bethel and Dan to discourage people from going to Jerusalem to worship.
questions.explanation: Jeroboam made two golden calves to keep the people from going to Jerusalem (1 Kings 12:28-29).

questions.question: True or False: Elijah was taken to heaven in a chariot of fire.
questions.explanation: Elijah's ascension is recorded in 2 Kings, not in 1 Kings.
questions.verseReference: 1 Kings does not record Elijah's ascension

questions.question: True or False: Ahab was succeeded by his son Jehoram as king of Israel.
questions.explanation: Ahab was succeeded by his son Jehoram (also called Joram) (1 Kings 22:40).

questions.question: True or False: Solomon refused to marry foreign princesses in order to keep Israel pure.
questions.explanation: Solomon loved many strange women, including foreign princesses, which led to his downfall (1 Kings 11:1-3).

questions.question: True or False: The LORD promised Solomon that He would dwell among the children of Israel if Solomon walked in His statutes.
questions.explanation: God promised to dwell among Israel if Solomon kept His commandments (1 Kings 6:12-13).

questions.question: True or False: The prophet Micaiah prophesied that Ahab would die in battle.
questions.explanation: Micaiah prophesied that Ahab would be killed in battle (1 Kings 22:17-28).

questions.question: True or False: Solomon's throne was made of gold and ivory.
questions.explanation: Solomon's throne was made of ivory and overlaid with fine gold (1 Kings 10:18-20).

questions.question: True or False: The altar in Bethel where Jeroboam offered sacrifices was blessed by a prophet from Judah.
questions.explanation: The prophet cursed the altar at Bethel, prophesying its destruction (1 Kings 13:2).

questions.question: True or False: Solomon's wisdom was recognized throughout all nations around Israel.
questions.explanation: Solomon's wisdom was renowned and attracted visitors from many nations (1 Kings 4:34).

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Give therefore thy servant an understanding heart to judge thy people, that I may discern between good and evil: for who is able to judge this thy great people?'
questions.explanation: This is Solomon's prayer to God for wisdom (1 Kings 3:9).

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And it came to pass at the end of twenty years, wherein Solomon had built the two ________ and the wall of Jerusalem round about,'
questions.explanation: Solomon built two houses (the temple and his own house) and the wall of Jerusalem (1 Kings 9:10).

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And he made an _______ of brass, twenty cubits in length, and ten cubits in breadth, and a line of ten cubits in height.'
questions.explanation: Solomon made a large molten sea of brass for the temple (1 Kings 7:23).

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And the LORD said unto Solomon, Because this was in thine heart, and thou hast not asked riches, wealth, or honour, nor the life of thine enemies, neither hast asked long life; but hast asked ________, that thou mayest discern judgment;'
questions.explanation: God commended Solomon for asking wisdom instead of riches or long life (1 Kings 3:11).
